Norman Thayer.Action: Follows Ethel slowly and watches bemusedly as she calls to the loons.
Fumbles with keys and opens the door to their home, allowing Ethel to follow in.
Studies the living room, looking confused and contemplative as he observes the memories and history in the home.
Fumbles with keys before opening the door.
Slowly follows Ethel out of the Buick, watching bemusedly.
Studies the room with confusion, as if struggling to place old memories.
Speaks to the phone operator in a somewhat playful, if confused, manner checking if the phone still works.
Repeats 'Who the hell is that?' looking at an old photo of himself and Ethel, displaying confusion or detachment.
Tries to check if the phone still works by dialing and test-calling the operator despite some confusion about the number and process.
Pushes the screen door which then falls over instead of opening properly, then he simply steps back inside without fixing it.
